docs.title: Welcome to RayPy
docs.text:
The RayPy is a Python interface to the RayforceDB columnar database.

  • Python Native Interface

    Seamless integration with Python, providing a familiar and intuitive API for data manipulation and analysis.

  • Columnar Storage

    Leverages RayforceDB's columnar storage for optimized data access and vectorized operations, enabling high-performance analytics.

  • Rich Data Types

    Comprehensive support for various data types including integers, floats, strings, symbols, dates, timestamps, and complex data structures like tables and dictionaries.

  • Open Source, MIT

    RayforceDB is licensed under MIT and available on GitHub

docs.title: How to install RayPy?
docs.text: RayPy is a Python library for ray tracing and optical simulations. It is designed to be easy to use and understand, and to be a powerful tool for researchers and engineers.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
RayPy can be installed using pip:

pip install raypy

docs.title: Introduction to RayPy
docs.text: RayPy is a powerful Python library for ray tracing and optical simulations. This guide will help you understand the basics and get started with RayPy.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
Here's a simple example of how to use RayPy:

import raypy

# Your code here
